thread.title: A Parting Shot

author: news24.com
title: A Parting Shot
text:
I shall post my parting shot of my favourite "The Epicurean paradox" about the problem of evil.
You of course may rightly ask, why, so what ?
Well it should be bourne in mind that Epicurus, an ancient Greek philosopher, lived 341â€“270 BC, long before Chrisitanity and Islam appeared on the scene to muddy the waters.
This paradox rationlises the inconsistent nature of the deity worshipped by a good portion of the world today. It shows a logical problem with an unfalsifiable proposision.
Epicurus, had the trilemma argument figured.
Amazingly, after all that time it is still relevant today.
 Is God willing to prevent evil, but not able?
 Then he is not omnipotent.
 Is he able, but not willing?
 Then he is malevolent.
 Is he both able and willing?
 Then whence cometh evil?
 Is he neither able nor willing?
 Then why call him God?
